Articles.Content:
The Co-21F is the latest in my most successful ship line, with the D version serving as KIDA's main warship. However sue to huge part overruns I am not exactly happy with it as its a bit of a lag beast.

Length: 30m (I got the length by standing a Kerbal on top while the ship was landing on Minmus)

Cost: 226,000

Mass: 217 tons

dV: 5400

TWR: 1.75

Parts: 584

Weaponry: 9 Hornet Missiles and 5 Heavy Rockets.

All these stats are for when the ship is fully fuelled and armed.

Download: https://www.dropbox.com/s/mkdeu8xrehko6ww/Co-21F.craft

The Co-21F looks a lot nicer than the Co-21D

Landed on Minmus

Firing the Heavy Rockets. They have a dV of around 1000m/s and are armour piercing.

Edited February 3, 2014 by Comrade Jenkens
Very cool, I like it.

I thought it will be the car....

anyway great design ;d
Is this the ship you wanted to attach the rail gun to?

Is this the ship you wanted to attach the rail gun to?

Yeah, but I couldn't find a projectile which was light enough yet still had a high impact tolerance. Also part count problems limited what I could do with it.
If you want I'll stick a Baxter on.it looks like it would fit snuggly on top of the lander can.

If you want I'll stick a Baxter on.it looks like it would fit snuggly on top of the lander can.

I'd be interested to see that. My PC is struggling with part count though.

I'm finding that my ships aren't changing much anymore and are no longer offering anything new. If ppl can say what they want to see in the future to mix things up a bit i'll try to implement them.
is there a launcher, does it ssto or did you cheat it into orbit?

Yeah, but I couldn't find a projectile which was light enough yet still had a high impact tolerance. Also part count problems limited what I could do with it.

It might need something smaller then what I've already designed. What size ammunition are you thinking of?
Do you mind if I download the craft and integrate the rail gun into it, I can make it so that it's still subassembly compatible

Do you mind if I download the craft and integrate the rail gun into it, I can make it so that it's still subassembly compatible

That would be good thanks The structure on the front was a railgun but I switched it with rockets as my pc was struggling.

Darn, I was just about to make a marathon class for Zokesia... well, I guess I'll just have to call it the Thermopylae class when I get working on it. :) Should I make it? It won't be much of a replica, but it will have most of the features of the UNSC inspiration. I might also have some odst pods for ONI SRU editions.

looks like a modified Halcyon now.

Edited February 4, 2014 by Spartwo
Wow that gun looks powerful! What does it fire and a what velocities?

13 reloadable 1x1 panels at about 250-300m/s.But it has a problem,the panel goes along one exhaust and the decoupler goes along another.I can make a single engine design which will have less panels which can't be reloaded or you can fire from an angle(not really a hard choice).

EDIT:As a little bonus I think it has less parts.

Edited February 4, 2014 by Spartwo
Autumn Class...

They named a class for one ship?

Edited February 4, 2014 by Spartwo
No, it`s a new cruiser classification inspired by the ship.
So it is..

That would be good thanks The structure on the front was a railgun but I switched it with rockets as my pc was struggling.

Kk , thats exactly what i was thinking of doing, will post when its done (tweaking could take a while, I want to make it powerful and accurate.

So here is what I've come up with so far:

Download link: http://rapidshare.com/share/6CCD73FEE33BA40E0EE2565CA94FF5CE

this is a radially attachable gun, I've set it up so that you double-toggle 1 to fire the gun, press space to load a bullet, which has to be fired almost right after. play around with it and tell me what you think

Your corvette has so many parts that it is hard to work on, so I thought making it seperate would be better. I'm not going to give up on integration though, I just need a better computer Also,i have concluded that Lv-t30's and aerospikes are not good engines to use for a railgun, far too unstable and have a tendency of cutting the clipped fuel lines.

Edited February 5, 2014 by Bleekosa
I tried adding it but my PC just won't handle that many parts.
My last post was a question would you rather an awkward firing mechanism or an inability to reload?
I'd rather be able to reload.
